subject: Sales
title: Confirmation Bias and Buyers
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Confirmation Bias and Buyers.

hook.text: A buyer finds one bad review of your product. Now every flaw glows neon bright in their mind.

buildup.text: Confirmation bias makes people seek evidence that supports what they already believe.

discovery.text: Once a buyer forms an opinion, they filter everything through it. Conflicting facts get ignored.

twist.text: This works in your favor too. A strong first impression makes buyers downplay later negatives.

climax.text: Shape early impressions carefully. The first story a buyer hears becomes their lens for everything.

punchline.text: First impressions don't just matter. They filter reality.

quiz.question: What does confirmation bias cause buyers to do?
options: Seek evidence supporting their existing belief
